lines.text:
[after Julie succeeds in a task she found difficult]
Congratulations, Julie-san.
Congratulations? That's all you're gonna say is congratulations? Don't I get a belt or something?
Buy belt more.
No, I mean a karate belt. Brown belt, black belt.
Why need belt?
So everyone knows I'm good!
You know you good. That important thing.
Oh come on, even Elvis Presley got a black belt.
Borrow from Elvis next time see him.
I wish I had courage like you.
I wish I had chocolate bar with almonds.
[last lines]
Julie-san, fighting not good. But if must fight... win.
What's going on?
Nothing. Just monks having good time.
I thought they were supposed to be spiritual
Never trust spiritual leader who doesn't dance.
[Dugan is upset that no one else is willing to fight Julie]
Enough!
No. It's not. War ain't over because one battle is.
Then we fight.

[surprised/obliges]
Oh yes.
[takes cap off to reveal tough bald head]
I'm gonna put your lights out
[Dugan grabs Miyagi's shirt and prepares to strike him but Miyagi easily rips Dugan's hands off. Dugan is shocked; the two then fight and after a moment it's over]

[holding Dugan to ground and preparing to strike him]
Now time to put your lights out.
[Mr. Miyagi instead lets him go. Dugan is very embarrassed. The students go up to him disappointed]
You said, you had all the answers, Colonel.
[after a brief pause]
You were wrong.

[Julie's babysitting three VERY active boys]
What are you doing here?
Miyagi figure children no have enough toys, so bring more. Nerf balls, flying discs, all kinds good stuff. You just have fun.
Have fun? Miyagi, they don't need any more toys, they need three child-sized straight jackets!
The sun is warm, the grass is green.
What?
If today Julie-san get angry, just you repeat those words.
Oh my god! My teeth don't match my nose!
Ambition without knowledge is like a boat on dry land
Boys are much easier!
I never think about my future.
Sure you do. What're you going to do next month?
Don't know.
What're you going to do next week?
Don't care.
What're you going to do in the next five seconds?
I'm going to make you swear that you won't tell anybody about the hawk.
When do I learn how to break boards and stuff like that?
Why break boards? What boards do to you? That kind stuff not teach you how to conquer anger, Julie-san. Understand?
Yeah.
